Reviews.Title: “Ewww!”
Reviews.Author: Heather315
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed for two nights here. The receptionist was very, very nice. Everything else was terrible though. The light in our room was almost hanging from the ceiling. A bottom piece of the lining along the wall was falling off. The coffee was terrible. The continental breakfast consisted of muffins. There were very few, and they weren't that great. The pool was down the whole time we stayed. Our bath tub had jets in it, that did not work. When we took a bath, it filled with disgusting pieces of crud from the jets. There were very few cable channels. The neighborhood was pretty terrible as well. To make everything worse, I'm now itching all over. I definitely wish we would have splurged for a nicer hotel!

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS BED BUGS BED BUGS!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tiny W
Reviews.Content: OMG!!! Stay as far away from this hotel as possible...not only is the staff rude and ignorant...they have the filthiest rooms I have EVER SEEN...including BED BUGS!!! And when we told them about it they didnt even care. Holes in the carpet and stains on the counter tops, dirty blankets on the beds, hair in the drains,the security lock was pulled out of the door, TV didnt work right, and SMELLY...worst night I have ever spent at any hotel...again, STAY FAR FAR AWAY...

Reviews.Title: “Think twice”
Reviews.Author: itchyfeetFt_Wayne
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this motel one night during the Big 10 game in Indianapolis. I began to have 2nd thoughts about it the minute I stepped out of our car! There were beer cans and empty beer bottles laying on the sidewalk to the entrance. They were still there when we left the next morning. When we got to our room, the TV didn't work; it kept rolling and didn't stop.There were stains on the bedspread so we took it off. The towels were so thin I had to ask for 2 extra towels. There was no coffee maker.There were 2 bedside lamps and one had a bulb burned out. The toilet was yellow with rust.However, the front desk people were extremely nice. That and the fact that the mattress was decent and it was the only room we could find so close to a big event in Indi were the only reasons we even stayed there. I would NOT go back again. Think twice befor staying here. For the full price of a Choice motel, it was NOT worth it!!!

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY!!”
Reviews.Author: Gurl00
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for 2 nights for my daughter and I. Not a child friendly atmosphere. The rooms were fair for the price, but not very clean. The breakfast is a JOKE!! The pool appears to be very nice in the pics, but be warned it is NASTY!! We did not get in it at all. DO NOT RECOMMEND to anyone looking for a nice pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “The worst”
Reviews.Author: Matt M
Reviews.Content: I can't remember ever staying in a worse hotel and I've stayed in plenty. Our "in room air conditioner" popped its circuit breaker about every 45 minutes making the nights hot and humid. The "continental breakfast" was very amusing. The most we ever saw were six little muffins in a case. One day we came out and all there was was a half empty gallon jug of milk on the counter. The room furnishings were old but decently comfortable and the WiFi worked very well. The bathroom was functional but seemed to be rotting away, probably from the humidity. If you wanted a cheap place to spend one night, I suppose you could do worse, but I certainly wouldn't go back.

Reviews.Title: “This place is a NIGHTMARE”
Reviews.Author: Knucc
Reviews.Content: Rodeway Inn does not employ trained and professional people. My mom was told to leave the room at 4:00a after arriving at midnite. The staff at the FD was incompetent and did not know what she was doing. The AM FD told me that she could only call the Managers if there was a fire. No Help whatsoever and kept smiling and saying Im Sorry for Her ignorance and my troubles and Inconvenience. This place is a JOKE.

Reviews.Title: “Woe is me for I am undone by this motel”
Reviews.Author: taliabo
Reviews.Content: The value is there, but I'm sorry I put my family through this...What a joke. The suite (yes, suite size) was indeed roomy, but furniture of a very tacky decor, outdated, and obviously in need of a major renovation (or wrecking ball). The heater unit was noisy and blew air directly on us while sleeping. The shock was the "continental breakfast"..at 7:45 AM we and another travelling family were incredulously greeted with...huh... an empty breakfast cubicle. I mean... like there was one banana there. When we gently inquired with the receptionist she seemed flustered, and hurriedly rushed to a locked closet and handed the 6 of us packaged muffins and offered milk from the desk food shop for "free". We passed. And will pass this Rodeway Inn next time when travelling through this area. But "ahem" ...good price.

Reviews.Title: “No Non-Smoking Rooms in this Place”
Reviews.Author: BridgetW
Reviews.Content: I reserved a non-smoking room for 3 nights and was given a room that reeked of smoke, had an ashtray and burns on the furniture. I told the staff there must be some mistake but they insisted it was a non-smoking room but did move me to another room that was less smelly but had and ash tray and burns, yet again. There are no non-smoking rooms in this hotel. So if this is an issue with you avoid this place. Also there were other issues. The property was very run down with no air-conditioning in common areas such as lobby, halls, breakfast area. Breakfast was another issue. It consisted of some juice or coffee and some really old bagels. The second day we skipped it entirely, not worth getting up for. My friend's room didn't even have a television!!! I know Econo Lodge is a budget hotel but I've stayed at far more inexpensive places and had a fine experience. There is no excuse for this place.

Reviews.Title: “Run...Run far and fast”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Please Note: This hotel has once again changed names. It now goes by Sunrise Hotel! Since we have been going to this hotel it has went from Quailty Inn...to Shadeland Inn...to Econo Lodge East...to now the Sunrise Hotel. On, Sept. 10, 2005, we have stayed at this hotel as it has went through many name/owner changes. We go with a large group every September for a race. We fill up nearly the entire hotel. This year I had read the reviews and went against my better judgement and went ahead and made our reservations one month prior to our trip. I reguested a pool side room since the pool is in doors...that was not a problem. When we checked in...they had lost my reservation, I had my confirmation number so they had to give me the price I had been given and not the new jacked up price they tried to give me. Our room was not ready so we had to come back in 2 hours...so we did. When I picked up my room key at the front desk I was pointed to a sign that told me that the pool was CLOSED for renovations. (why wasn't I told this when I made my reservations? I would not have paid more for this room!) The room itself was not as bad as I expected after reading the reviews....until I went into the bathroom (which was not until mearly midnight)! OH MY GOD...The shower was nothing more than a wall of MOLD...at base of the tub the cover was about 2-3 inches to small, the toilet was pulled out away from the wall by about 5-6 inches. I wish we would have went into the restroom when we first arrived and dropped off our belongings...we would have just left then! We got back to our room at nearly midnight. We needed to at least rince off and brush our teeth, go to the restroom...normal things any family would expect to do in a hotel room. Well not without WATER! That is right...no water! I went down to the front desk...I was told that they had to turn it off for a minute but that would have it back on within 45 minutes. So we brushed out teeth with a bottle a water we had with us and went to bed. The next morning I got up first...went to the rest room and once again NO WATER! When we complain to the front desk again...we were told that they were sorry and that there was a leak. Not to be rude but honestly that is not my problem and I paid for a room with water and didn't get one. I want my money back!!! I was told it was out of their control. Don't do the same thing I did and blow off these reviews...it will save you more than money! While I have gotton NO where with the hotel in trying to retrieve my money, I have posted this review, contacted the BBB, contacted the Indiana Fire Marshall, my local televesion stations "Troubleshooter", I have written a letter to the hotel in care of the Owner/Operator, Have written the Indiana State Dept. of health, and plan to still write letters to the editors of every Indianapolis newspaper. I have a big mouth...and I aint affraid to use it! I am sure I will cost them far more in loss of business than if they would have just gave me my money back! Just say no to this hotel...what ever name it is going to go to next!

Reviews.Title: “please dont stay here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: me and my husband stay here for the brickyard 500. i read some of the reviews online so i called to see if they had made improvements i was told that they did. when we arrived the lobby was nice but that was the only thing we we got into our rooms there had not been clean the floor was dirty and the mattress on the bed was stained brown the sheets and bed cover was also stained. we found 2 used condom rappers under the beds. i would not recommend this place at all we ended up leaving and going somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “THIS IS THE WORST HOTEL IN THE WORLD”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This has to be the worst hotel in the world. The outside is very deceiving. We were there in April, 2005. Our hotel room was disgusting and in disrepair. The plumbing in the bathroom was backwards - when we ran the shower, the water ran all over the bathroom floor. The vent and all other metal surfaces were rusted. The wood was peeling. The tub was moldy and gross. The front desk was SO not accomodating. I asked for extra pillows which the manager himself said he'd bring to our room in 30 minutes. He never did. I went back an hour later and the manager was gone and the front desk clerk told me he didn't have a key so I couldn't get any pillows. HUH?? Customer service?? Then, there was a party happening in the pool area RIGHT OUTSIDE our hotel room - I mean, literally on the other side of the patio doors. There was drinking, loud music and clanging beer bottles. We could not sleep. I had to call the front desk (starting at 12:30am) FOUR TIMES to get the security guard to take care of it. We heard the drunk partyers laughing and swearing at the guard. We have two young children - we were literally scared that these people would come and find us. It was frightening. We will NEVER stay there again and highly recommend you don't either.

Reviews.Title: “The Shady Inn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Shadeland Inn for four days and three nights it is by far the worst place I ever paid to stay.My room was cleaned only once during my stay...I had to request for towels daily.The bathroom had mold on walls,floors and faucets...the bath tub leeked water so bad that when I bathe the whole bathroom floor would be covered with water.Their lobby stayed hot due to the heated pool...it was summer and it was hotter in the lobby than it was outdoors.I have never stayed at a motel,hotel or inn as unprofessional as the Shadeland it is awful.This establishment is a rip off and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “don't let the pictures fool you”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were given four different rooms and all were terrible! the first one smelled of smoke so bad it about knocked us over. We didn't even cross the threshold. The second the back of the toilet was broken in half. The third didn't have the security lock and the door wouldn't latch. In the fourth tiles were falling off the tub surround, the tub faucet ran all the time...not drip ran and made a humming noise. All the rooms were dirty and moldy, the bathrooms were the worst. I saw the other bad review and thought well thats only one person who had a bad experince....They are not alone. The hotel was nearly empty.

HotelInfo.Name: Rodeway Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 3525 North Shadeland Avenue, Indianapolis, IN 46226 (Formerly Sunrise Hotel)
